title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Amphora Red (Alentejano)
description: Fermented and aged in clay amphorae, the wine is full of red-berry flavors. It has a lean character, bringing out tannins and acidity as well as the fruit. The juicy fruit and attractive balance of the wine show that it is ready to drink.

title: Coyote Canyon 2017 Albariño (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Pleasing aromas of pear, melon and banana chips are followed by pure fruit flavors with a rounded feel. It brings a pleasing snap of acidity on the banana-filled finish.

title: Cusumano 2017 Alta Mora Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Delicate scents of wild rose, woodland berry and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The fresh palate offers red currant, pomegranate and a hint of saline alongside tangy acidity.

title: D'Arenberg 2016 The Olive Grove Chardonnay (McLaren Vale-Adelaide Hills)
description: Bursting through the gate with peach, lemon balm and ginger spice, this is a medium-bodied, fruity little number with a good whack of toasty oak. It's simple but enjoyable.

title: Delfino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Umpqua Valley)
description: A buttery mouthfeel and a palate loaded with sweet spices make this instantly charming. It's forward and certainly flavorful, though off-center as far as varietal specificity. Aged 18 months in French oak, how much was new unspecified, it hides its black cherry fruit in a wash of spicy tannins.

title: Di Meo 2010 Vigna Olmo Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, underbrush, withered violet, black-skinned grape and eucalyptus mingle with a whiff of wet fur that eventually blows off. The palate is rather evolved, showing prune, espresso, clove and toasted hazelnut alongside drying tannins.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Sur le Fort  (Sancerre)
description: Light, bright and still fresh, this is a fruity wine. Its acidity, green fruits and light texture push it forward and lead to a refreshing, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2016  Sancerre
description: This perfumed, red-cherry-flavored wine has just a hint of wood. It is young and full of juicy fruit with a dry core that will soften to give a rounded, bright wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine La Croix Canat 2017 Chantepleure  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Tinel-Blondelet, this estate has made a crisply textured wine, intense with acidity and still very young. Its freshness and brightness need to soften, so drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2017 Enclos de Malmbray  (Sancerre)
description: Malmbray is the home village of the Roblin winery. The Kimmeridgian chalk soil gives intensely crisp wines, like this, that are full of taut citrus and herbal flavors. Drink from 2019.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This remains one of the best wine values on the planet: a Loire-style, stainless-steel fermented beauty that the winery has been making for 46 years. Guava, peach and apricot surround buzzy acidity in a crowd-pleasing quaff of undeniable quality and freshness.

title: Emerald Hare 2016 Red (Mendocino)
description: This is an elegant, dry wine with great balance, a sleek texture and plenty of black-cherry and dark plum flavors. Equal parts Zinfandel and Merlot plus a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon form the blend. Good acidity and moderate tannins give it some nice heft on the palate and there is little oak influence to take away from its fruit focus.

title: Encostas de Estremoz 2017 Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: As its name indicates, this wine comes from vineyards around the hilltop town of Estremoz. It is a young fruity wine with soft tannins and open juicy black-fruit flavors. It is rich and ready to drink.

title: Gratavinum 2011 2?R Red (Priorat)
description: Raisiny aromas of prune and desiccated cassis feed into a full pudgy palate. This is rich to the breaking point, with ultraripe flavors of baked plum and berry fruits. Chocolate is the main flavor on an oaky, thick finish.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2014 Cold Fusion Red (South Coast)
description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Petite Sirah starts with tart red-currant aromas mixed with marjoram, oregano, light licorice and soil. The lighter-bodied palate is strongly herbal and minty.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2017 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)
description: All about ripe, tropical fruits and freshness, this is an immediately attractive wine. It is open, easy and developing quickly. Already the bright fruits and tangy acidity are forward and refreshing. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Hyland 2016 Dijon 115 Old Vine Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The winery has added “Old Vine” and “Single Clone” to its labels, though without much information as to how old the vines may be. It's an unregulated term to begin with, so specific information would be welcome. Purple berries, orange juice and some alcoholic burn comprise this rather straightforward effort. Drink now–2022.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Sonoma County provides the majority of the fruit for this multi-appellation red, a bold, richly layered wine with grippy, gritty texture. Full-bodied boysenberry flavor upholds seasonings of licorice and cardamom, remaining velvety on the finish.

title: J Wrigley NV Jubilation Rosé of Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Sealed with a crown cap and sporting a festive label, this bursts forth with lush fruit flavors of hard cherry candy and strawberry soda. You won't mistake it for true Champagne, and you won't mind that a bit. It's fresh, lively and flat-out fun.

title: Jacquart NV Extra Brut Mosaïque  (Champagne)
description: This wine makes up for the low dosage with the clean, perfumed richness of the fruit. A blend of all three main Champagne grapes, but with a slight preponderance of Chardonnay, it has a crisp texture, touches of minerality and a bright, lively and freshly fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
